PRIME MINISTER
FOR PRESS AUGUST 16, 1976
MINISTER TO ASSIST THE PRIME MINISTER IN WOMEN'S AFFAIRS
The. Prime Minister announced today that he has appointed the
Hon. A. A. Street, Minister for Employment and Industrial
Relations, l. as Minister Assisting the Prime Minister in
the handling of women's affairs.
The Prime Minister decided . that assistance was needed in the
light of the increased tempo of activity in this area, since
the establishment of women's policy units in various
Departments and the Interdepartmental Working Group on
Women's Affairs. The Government is also preparing for
regular consultations with women's groups with the objective
of establishing a Women's Advisory Committee.
As is the practice when Ministers assist the Prime Minister in
specific policy areas, the Prime Minister will continue to
be involved in major policy considerations.
